intro: Eschscholzia yainacensis, commonly known as the Yainacensis poppy, is a rare and endemic species native to specific regions of the western United States. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes many flowering plants known for their showy blooms and medicinal properties. The plant typically features delicate, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from pale yellow to orange, often with a dark red or purple center. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. Eschscholzia yainacensis thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
